plan: In the first round, I'll adopt a cautious strategy, exiting once the price approaches my estimated value minus a small buffer to ensure a positive profit. This helps gauge the aggressiveness of Betty and Charles. In the second round, I'll pivot to a more aggressive strategy, staying longer to test higher bids, especially if the first round's values were high. This approach balances risk and learning, maximizing potential profit by adapting to opponents' behaviors and value distributions. I'll use insights from round one to refine my second-round strategy for optimal bidding.

In Round 1, I'll adopt an aggressive strategy by staying in the auction until the price reaches 75% of my value for the prize. This will help gauge opponents' bidding behavior. In Round 2, I'll adjust based on Round 1 insights. If opponents bid aggressively, I'll exit earlier, around 60% of my value, to avoid overpaying. If they bid conservatively, I'll push closer to my full value. This adaptive approach maximizes profit by balancing risk and reward, leveraging insights from previous rounds to refine my strategy.

In the first round, I'll bid aggressively, staying in until the price nears my value to gather data on competitors' behavior. I'll note when Andy and Betty drop out to estimate their value range. In the second round, I'll adopt a more conservative strategy, exiting earlier to maximize profit if my value is lower, using insights from the first round to predict their bidding patterns. This approach balances risk and data collection, optimizing long-term profit by adapting to observed strategies.

In this round, I'll bid more aggressively, staying in the auction until the price reaches my value minus 5. This strategy tests higher bids, leveraging insights from round one, and aims to maximize profit by adapting to opponents' behaviors and potential value distributions.

In Round 1, I'll bid up to 16 (75% of my value) to test opponents' aggression. In Round 2, I'll adjust: exit at 60% if they bid high, or push to full value if they bid low. This balances risk and optimizes profit based on insights.

In this round, I'll bid conservatively, exiting early if my value is low to secure profit. I'll closely monitor Andy's and Betty's exit points to refine their value estimates, adjusting my strategy dynamically to maximize long-term profit based on their observed bidding patterns.
